alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 08 at 2:04PM EDT until April 08 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Bartow County in northwestern Georgia... East Central Floyd County in northwestern Georgia... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 204 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring across portions of Shannon and south of Adairsville. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rome, Cartersville, Adairsville, White, Kingston, Shannon, Cassville, Pinson, Folsom, Armuchee, Lindale, Pine Log, Funkhouser and Coosa. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
